Models

Treat EV Batteries at End-of-Life
  • Decomposition
  • ICOM

Activity: Crush/Size Reduce

Description

Notes:

Definitions:
Crushing - mechanical reduction of the particle size of a material by fracturing large pieces into multiple smaller pieces. From ISO 14284:2022.

Particle size reduction - process of crushing or grinding the sample to reduce the particle size. From ISO 1213-2:2024.

Standards:

References:
Amalia, D., Singh, P., Zhang, W., & Nikoloski, A. N. (2025). A review of pretreatment methods for spent lithium-ion batteries to produce black mass–comparison of processes of Asia Pacific recyclers. Mineral processing and extractive metallurgy review, 46(5), 626-643.

Huang, C., Lipatnikov, A. N., Lövström, C., Smajovic, N., Andersson, L., & Ismail, A. (2025). Experimental investigation of dust explosions with a focus on black mass in battery recycling. Journal of Loss Prevention in the Process Industries, 94, 105526.

Makuza, B., Yu, D., Huang, Z., Tian, Q., & Guo, X. (2021). Dry grinding-carbonated ultrasound-assisted water leaching of carbothermally reduced lithium-ion battery black mass towards enhanced selective extraction of lithium and recovery of high-value metals. Resources, Conservation and Recycling, 174, 105784.

Wilke, C., Werner, D. M., Kaas, A., & Peuker, U. A. (2023). Influence of the crusher settings and a thermal pre-treatment on the properties of the fine fraction (black mass) from mechanical lithium-ion battery recycling. Batteries, 9(10), 514.
